info.description: This is a dynamic API generated by PostgREST
info.title: PostgREST API

get.summary: Table to hold kyc information of users, just a placeholder for now

get.summary: Table to hold execution information such as when the execution started, which template was executed and time taken for query execution

post.summary: Table to hold execution information such as when the execution started, which template was executed and time taken for query execution

delete.summary: Table to hold execution information such as when the execution started, which template was executed and time taken for query execution

patch.summary: Table to hold execution information such as when the execution started, which template was executed and time taken for query execution

get.summary: Table to connect query templates to tokens. Query templates belong, are assigned to tokens, and can be only executed by the token they are assigned to.

post.summary: Table to connect query templates to tokens. Query templates belong, are assigned to tokens, and can be only executed by the token they are assigned to.

delete.summary: Table to connect query templates to tokens. Query templates belong, are assigned to tokens, and can be only executed by the token they are assigned to.

patch.summary: Table to connect query templates to tokens. Query templates belong, are assigned to tokens, and can be only executed by the token they are assigned to.

get.summary: Table to hold the ids of JSON Web token identifying the project on our platform. The hashes of the tokens are also stored.

post.summary: Table to hold the ids of JSON Web token identifying the project on our platform. The hashes of the tokens are also stored.

delete.summary: Table to hold the ids of JSON Web token identifying the project on our platform. The hashes of the tokens are also stored.

patch.summary: Table to hold the ids of JSON Web token identifying the project on our platform. The hashes of the tokens are also stored.

get.summary: Table to hold query templates - SQL SELECT query template with possible dynamic arguments. Most applications will use few fixed query templates, but invoke many more queries. Query templates can be prepared with SQL PREPARE statement, and form the basis for efficient caching and sharing of resources by multiple instances of the same application.

post.summary: Table to hold query templates - SQL SELECT query template with possible dynamic arguments. Most applications will use few fixed query templates, but invoke many more queries. Query templates can be prepared with SQL PREPARE statement, and form the basis for efficient caching and sharing of resources by multiple instances of the same application.

delete.summary: Table to hold query templates - SQL SELECT query template with possible dynamic arguments. Most applications will use few fixed query templates, but invoke many more queries. Query templates can be prepared with SQL PREPARE statement, and form the basis for efficient caching and sharing of resources by multiple instances of the same application.

patch.summary: Table to hold query templates - SQL SELECT query template with possible dynamic arguments. Most applications will use few fixed query templates, but invoke many more queries. Query templates can be prepared with SQL PREPARE statement, and form the basis for efficient caching and sharing of resources by multiple instances of the same application.

post.summary: Table to hold basic information about application projects created to users

post.summary: Confirm primary or secondary email address for current user. The function retunrs jsonb object with applied confirmed_at. If Email has already confirmed the existing confirmed_at will be returned

schema.description: Confirm primary or secondary email address for current user. The function retunrs jsonb object with applied confirmed_at. If Email has already confirmed the existing confirmed_at will be returned

post.summary: Function to set a user to inactive state in the user table. We are not doing a hard delete. The function returns Success or Error as a JSON object

schema.description: Function to set a user to inactive state in the user table. We are not doing a hard delete. The function returns Success or Error as a JSON object

post.summary: Return User_id of the currently authenticated user, or null if not authenticated.

schema.description: Return User_id of the currently authenticated user, or null if not authenticated.

post.summary: Expires the given session and resets the session cookie.

schema.description: Expires the given session and resets the session cookie.

post.summary: Perform user registration, login the user and call streamcardano.login so that a session is started. Returns streamcardano.user (id, first_name, primary_email) of registered user.

schema.description: Perform user registration, login the user and call streamcardano.login so that a session is started. Returns streamcardano.user (id, first_name, primary_email) of registered user.

post.summary: Reset the expiration time of the given session.

schema.description: Reset the expiration time of the given session.

post.summary: Function to return basic information of logged in user. Returns id, first name and email. Once the sc.app_user_id variable is set to the id of a record in app_user, we can use this function. For example,
post.description:
new_database=# SELECT  set_config('sc.app_user_id', 14::text, FALSE);
 set_config 
------------
 14
(1 row)

new_database=# SELECT * FROM  streamcardano."current_user"();
 id | first_name |          primary_email          
----+------------+---------------------------------
 14 | John       | sc-test-user1@streamcardano.com
(1 row)

schema.description:
Function to return basic information of logged in user. Returns id, first name and email. Once the sc.app_user_id variable is set to the id of a record in app_user, we can use this function. For example, 
new_database=# SELECT  set_config('sc.app_user_id', 14::text, FALSE);
 set_config 
------------
 14
(1 row)

new_database=# SELECT * FROM  streamcardano."current_user"();
 id | first_name |          primary_email          
----+------------+---------------------------------
 14 | John       | sc-test-user1@streamcardano.com
(1 row)

post.summary: Creates a new session given valid credentials. This function in turn calls auth.login which generates a token on successful login. This function will return the streamcardano.user (id, first_name, primary_email) on successful login

schema.description: Creates a new session given valid credentials. This function in turn calls auth.login which generates a token on successful login. This function will return the streamcardano.user (id, first_name, primary_email) on successful login

kyc.description: Table to hold kyc information of users, just a placeholder for now

id.description:
Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

app_user_id.description:
Note:
This is a Foreign Key to `app_user.id`.<fk table='app_user' column='id'/>

created_at.description: Time of creation kyc in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS). Cannot differ from now() at insert time.

query_execution.description: Table to hold execution information such as when the execution started, which template was executed and time taken for query execution

id.description:
Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

template_id.description:
Note:
This is a Foreign Key to `query_template.id`.<fk table='query_template' column='id'/>

created_at.description: Time of starting query execution on streamcardano server in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS). May differ from time when query started to execute on remote server.

template_token.description: Table to connect query templates to tokens. Query templates belong, are assigned to tokens, and can be only executed by the token they are assigned to.

id.description:
Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

template_id.description:
Note:
This is a Foreign Key to `query_template.id`.<fk table='query_template' column='id'/>

token_id.description:
Note:
This is a Foreign Key to `token.id`.<fk table='token' column='id'/>

project_id.description:
Note:
This is a Foreign Key to `project.id`.<fk table='project' column='id'/>

created_at.description: Time of creation template token in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS). Cannot differ from now() at insert time.

token.description: Table to hold the ids of JSON Web token identifying the project on our platform. The hashes of the tokens are also stored.

id.description:
Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

project_id.description:
Note:
This is a Foreign Key to `project.id`.<fk table='project' column='id'/>

token_id.description: Public identifier of the access token.

hashed_secret.description: Hash of secret to verify with access token.

created_at.description: Time of creation token in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS). Cannot differ from now() at insert time.

query_template.description: Table to hold query templates - SQL SELECT query template with possible dynamic arguments. Most applications will use few fixed query templates, but invoke many more queries. Query templates can be prepared with SQL PREPARE statement, and form the basis for efficient caching and sharing of resources by multiple instances of the same application.

id.description:
Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

created_at.description: Time of creation query_template in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS). Cannot differ from now() at insert time.

permitted_at.description: Time  when the query was permitted in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS). Either date of token promotion, or explicit permission.

project_id.description:
Note:
This is a Foreign Key to `project.id`.<fk table='project' column='id'/>

project.description: Table to hold basic information about application projects created to users

id.description:
Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

app_user_id.description:
Note:
This is a Foreign Key to `app_user.id`.<fk table='app_user' column='id'/>

row_limit.description: Maximum rows returned in a single query or update.

created_at.description: Time of creation project in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS). Cannot differ from now() at insert time.

app_user.description: Table to hold basic user information

id.description:
Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

created_at.description: Time of creation user in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS). Cannot differ from now() at insert time.

deactivation_date.description: Time of user's deactivation in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS).

confirmed_at.description: Time of confirmation primary_email in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS). Confirmation cannot be older than created_at and newer than now()

contact.description: Table to hold contact information of end users

id.description:
Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

app_user_id.description:
Note:
This is a Foreign Key to `app_user.id`.<fk table='app_user' column='id'/>

created_at.description: Time of creation contact in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS). Cannot differ from now() at insert time.

confirmed_at.description: Time of confirmation secondary_email in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS). Validation cannot be older than created_at and newer than now()

payment.description: Table to hold information of payments made by users

id.description:
Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

app_user_id.description:
Note:
This is a Foreign Key to `app_user.id`.<fk table='app_user' column='id'/>

created_at.description: Time of creation payment in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS). Cannot differ from now() at insert time.
